text: Centaurea jacea (brown knapweed or brownray knapweed) is a species of herbaceous perennial plants in the genus Centaurea native to dry meadows and open woodland throughout Europe. It grows to tall, and flowers mainly from June to September. Centaurea jacea In Britain, it is often found as a hybrid of black knapweed, Centaurea nigra. Unlike the black knapweed, the flower heads always look as if they are rayed, forming a more open star rather than a brush-like tuft. ==References== ==External links== * jacea Category:Flora of Norway Category:Plants described in 1753 Category:Taxa named by Carl Linnaeus
title: Centaurea jacea
